To me, it was all inclusive.
It was Irish to the Irish.
It sounded Scotch to the Scotch.
It was a typical English-American word, it flowed.
"McDonald's." It was easy for the kids to say and remember.
And I like the sound of it.
It sounded wholesome and it sounded genuine.
I don't like these gimmick type names.
Burger this, burger that, and all that kind of stuff.
"McDonald's." It's got a nice sounding name, sounds like "Tiffany's."
And I think we are the "Tiffany's" of  the hamburger business.
